newsitem.title: YEMEN: Britain to boost trade links with Yemen-Rifkind.
newsitem.headline: Britain to boost trade links with Yemen-Rifkind.

text.p: Britain plans to boost its trade relations with Yemen whose economy is moving in the right direction, British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind said on Wednesday.
Rifkind said more British cabinet ministers will be visiting Yemen to look into ways to improving trade between the two countries.
"The potential is quite substantial given that this is a country of 16 million people...It is a poor country but its economy is firmly moving in the market economy direction," Rifkind told reporters.
He was speaking after talks with President Ali Abdullah Saleh and before flying home at the end of a Middle East tour.
Yemen's economy, hit by a brief civil war in 1994, is slowly improving under IMF-agreed economic reforms.
British officials, who see Yemen as a potential future market for British firms, said Britain was Yemen's second largest trading partner in terms of imports after the United States.

Rifkind had arrived in Yemen on Tuesday on the last leg of his tour during which he launched the idea of a new Middle East body designed to encourage regional cooperation and prevent escalation of conflicts.
